item.title: Oblivion Remastered: Best Early Game Locations For Easy Loot
item.description:
Summary

  • Oblivion Remastered enhances graphics and gameplay, giving players a fresh experience exploring Cyrodiil.
  • While many of the locations remain the same as the original, there are some notable differences.
  • Ayleid Ruins are great for starters, as they contain items like Welkynd Stones, which are both useful and valuable.

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has been a real treat for both the series' hardcore fans and newcomers, especially re-exploring the beautiful province of Cyrodiil with its new, overhauled graphics.

Though much remains the same, there have been smaller tweaks to some parts of the original game, especially the changes to the difficulty and loot, which can make exploring areas feel a bit different this time around. Luckily, when starting out, players can prioritize certain locations and activities first to get some easy loot and experience early on and have a smooth ride for the rest of the game.

1 Vilverin

The First Ayleid Ruin

An easy pick when starting is Vilverin, an Ayleid Ruin located just across the river from the Imperial City Prison Sewers exit after the game’s introduction. Ayleid Ruins are dotted throughout the map and can be great locations for some high-value items.

Vilverin specifically can be done right out of the gate. It contains only a handful of easy enemies, bandits, skeletons, and a couple of zombies, a piece of cake even on higher difficulty levels. Most notably, these ruins contain many Welkynd Stones, which can be used one-time to fully restore magicka. Even rarer, the Varla Stone, which also has a one-time use function for recharging all enchanted items in a player's inventory. They are both great to have on hand, but are also quite valuable, especially the Varla Stone, which can be sold to enchanting merchants for a few hundred gold each.

2 Rockmilk

Marauders vs. Black Bow Bandits

Rockmilk Cave can easily be found in the southern part of Cyrodiil when traveling between Bravil and Leyawiin, and is made up of two main areas, Rockmilk Cave and Rockmilk Haven.

This seemingly normal cave has a unique twist compared to other locations in the game, though. Inside the cave are two rival factions, Marauders and Black Bow Bandits, who will attack both the player and each other, making for a pretty chaotic experience. Fortunately, they aren’t too different from the average bandit, so they are easy to deal with. On top of that, the Black Bow Bandit enemies will always drop their namesake Black Bow, which can be sold for around 100 gold each, making it a pretty profitable location to visit.

3 Sercen

Another Ruin North Of The Imperial City

Just above the province’s capital, which most will visit first, is Sercen, another ruin like Vilverin, with some more Ayleid goodies to start players off on the right foot in their playthrough.

Luckily, this one is much more concise than the other ruins, being a smaller location with essentially only one open room containing a handful of bandits, no big deal even at the lowest of levels. More importantly, it includes a fair amount of those aforementioned Welkynd Stones for some easy early-game septims, and a few chests scattered around with some more loot inside (thanks to the group of bandits). And with it being so close to the Imperial City, it's an easy way to pick up a few hundred gold in a couple of minutes.

4 Robber's Glen

A Small Cave Just Northwest Of Bravil

With a name like Robber's Glen Cave, it sounds like the perfect place to find a group of bandits or highwaymen and their stash of stolen items. While it might’ve been at one point, there are no bandits within this cave, or humans for that matter.

This location, just northwest of Bravil, is especially a great place to hit for any player focusing on alchemy, due to the abundance of the Imp Gall ingredient that can be found within. The primary enemies here are Imps - small, winged creatures that can use either fire, frost, or shock magic attacks. These are rather weak attacks overall and can easily be dodged, making the imps pretty trivial opponents. Aside from that, there are also a good number of chests lying about once the Imps are dealt with, making for some easy loot when traveling down to Bravil.

5 The Arena

The Imperial City’s Colosseum

The Arena is one of the many activities The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion has always been known for, allowing players to fight to the death, or bet on the battles of others.

While betting can be a lucrative venture in Oblivion , those who prefer to take an even bigger chance will be rewarded with copious amounts of gold for risking their own life in battle (if they survive, that is). As players continue with each fight, they can rise through the ranks and eventually become the Arena Champion, a title offering its own benefits as well. Aside from the big plus of gold for winning, the Arena is also a good way to gain experience on the side, and it's a hard-to-miss location, being right within the capital that players usually visit first when starting the game.

6 Fyrelight

In The Heart Of Cyrodiil's Wine Region

Located in the West Weald region near the affluent city of Skingrad lies Fyrelight Cave, another network of caverns worth exploring in the early game. This cave is a bit larger than the other similar locations mentioned so far, being made up of three different areas.

The opposition will be some imps at first, not much to be worried about. But once players reach slightly higher levels, the enemies will change to ogres and trolls, which can be a bit more challenging, so it's best to start with this location at a lower level. What makes the location great in the early game is the river system in the middle that leads to a small treasure room, containing some decent loot worth grabbing that can be sold to nearby vendors in Skingrad.

7 Greenmead Cave

They Don't Call It "The Gold Road" For Nothing!

When traveling along the Gold Road between the Imperial City and Skingrad, players can stumble upon Greenmead, yet another cave system split into three areas with some decent loot on offer.

Greenmead is one of the more dangerous locations mentioned here, containing tougher enemies like Minotaurs, Spriggans, and the worst of all, Will-o-the-Wisps, which can only be damaged with magic attacks. If players are careful and come prepared, though, the cave system is brimming with loot. Including the possibility of some high-value enchanted items, which can fetch a pretty penny, so it can definitely be a worthwhile location to visit in the early levels.

8 Garden Of Dareloth

One Mysterious Guild Meeting

While not a lucrative location itself, it's certainly worth mentioning due to its significance in becoming a part of a certain “mysterious” guild.

Located within the Imperial City’s Waterfront District is The Garden of Dareloth, where a guild meeting will take place around midnight after snooping around for some local rumors. From there, players can join the Thieves Guild, and, as the name suggests, they will offer all sorts of contracts for stealing high-value items in return for copious amounts of gold in the process. This path isn’t one for the moral players, but is easily one of the most profitable in the game if chosen.

item.title: Risk of Rain 2 Alloyed Collective Content Wish List
item.description:
There’s plenty of excitement around Risk of Rain 2 now that Alloyed Collective has been announced. It’s safe to say that Risk of Rain 2 's Seekers of the Storm DLC did not get off to the greatest start, but the new developer showed its determination to turn things around, and the expansion now sits as a highly regarded piece of content alongside Survivors of the Void.

With Solus taking the spotlight in the next expansion, Gearbox has free rein to explore whatever it likes. Risk of Rain 2 doesn’t often get large content updates, but many fans are assuring the studio that it should take whatever time it needs to make Alloyed Collective the best it can be. Still, that hasn’t stopped wish-listing, and there are tons of ideas floating about like little Empathy Cores.

A New and Returning Survivor in Risk of Rain 2's Alloyed Collective

Previously, Seekers of the Storm brought Chef back into the mix from Risk of Rain 1 . A lot of the speculation about the new expansion points to HAN-D returning in Risk of Rain 2 's Alloyed Collective, as some fans believe the final shot of a Drone being grabbed is a signature of HAN-D’s love of using Drones as weapons. It would make sense, as the expansion is set to explore Drones a lot further, adding new customization and build options, so HAN-D would be a perfect Survivor to complement this.

The new Survivor is much more of a mystery. Given the Solus theme, it can be speculated that it could be some kind of salvager, a character who uses machinery and Scrap to their advantage. Scrap is certainly a mechanic that has some more room to explore, as at the moment it is only useful for trading items, but there’s nothing to stop it from being used as a consumable for other purposes. Indeed, the new Risk of Rain Survivor could even be of Solus origin themselves. Though it might seem a little absurd at first, there are far stranger Survivors such as Heretic out there, and a controllable floating orb would certainly be distinct.

The Boss of Alloyed Collective Could Be a Big Departure From the Rest of Risk of Rain 2

One of the biggest additions coming with Alloyed Collective is a new endgame boss, and speculation is rife about what it could be. Previous content has focused heavily on the difficult relationship of Risk of Rain 2 's Mithrix and Providence, and the many characters seeking to idolize them, such as False Son, but Gearbox seems to be using this new expansion to tell its own story. With little lore on the Solus units, they’re the perfect canvas for creating a new type of final boss. Gearbox has described it as “reshaping the endgame,” which isn’t supposed to be taken literally, but it is hopefully a boss that is more than just a big enemy.

The trailer names an enemy called Solus Wing, which some have suggested could be the final boss. It wouldn’t be the first time that the final boss has been featured prominently before release, as Seekers of the Storm did with False Son, so it’s possible.

Other, more out-there comments suggest the boss could be an entire stage, referencing the Risk of Rain 2 's Solus Mother Unit, a part of the Solus faction that has not yet been seen in the game, and all the Solus constructs originally came from. Survivors could well be fighting on top or inside the Mother Unit itself, destroying it piece by piece as they get swarmed by defenders, which would be an incredibly cool departure from the norm.

How Alloyed Collective Could Explore the Solus More

Siren’s Call introduced the Solus and Vulture enemies and established the relationship between the two. On Petrichor 5, the Vultures have hacked the Solus to defend their nests, turning what was once a neutral third party into another defender for the planet. But Alloyed Collective will likely be exploring new angles to Solus beyond them being thralls to Vultures, giving them their own distinct identity.

As mentioned, the Solus Mother Unit would be a big contender for expanding on the Solus lore, and some players hope they will get to see the mothership in one form or another. Whatever it ends up being, the sheer variety of new stages in Alloyed Collective should give an excellent insight into the faction.

Gearbox has described them as “betrayed and abandoned,” not meant to survive the planet, and a lot of the indications seen in stage screenshots show the places that the Solus make their homes have been ravaged, littered with hollow shells and drilling works. Some fans have speculated that this is what has caused such a variety of new Solus constructs in Risk of Rain 2 's new expansion trailer, as the abandoned constructs adapt to their new environments, making do with the scraps of previous iterations to improve themselves.

Alloyed Collective Could Improve Drones for Good

Drones will be getting a big revamp in the upcoming expansion, with a new station set aside for modifying Drones to better suit particular playstyles. This is quite a big change for Risk of Rain 2 , as Drones have previously been quite RNG-dependent, relying on players finding first the right type of Drone, acquiring Risk of Rain 2 's red item Spare Drone Parts, and being able to keep them all alive somehow if they wanted to make a build around Drones. It’s also unusual because Risk of Rain 2 has very few customization options like this. Outside the Lunar Bazaar and Artifacts, there are no easy ways to simply improve aspects of a character outside of getting lucky item and printer spawns.

HAN-D's affinity for Drones could give them more synergy with Drones than they had in Risk of Rain 1 .

One of the new Drones hinted to be coming is a Drone that throws things. Whether this means throwing objects or enemies isn’t yet known, but it will certainly have some interesting consequences given the game’s dodgy physics. As there are seven Drones confirmed to be coming, there are a lot of options, such as making Drones that give shields to players, or ones that act as bomb Drones, blowing themselves up in the face of foes. Whatever they are, more ways to make Drones a legitimate build in Risk of Rain 2 outside spamming The Backup would be incredible for some Survivors.

item.title: 7 Best Looking Survival Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Survival games have evolved into visually stunning products, blending impressive graphics with challenging gameplay.
  • Top survival games like Frostpunk 2, Subnautica, and S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 offer detailed environments and engaging storylines.
  • Titles like Sons of the Forest and Atomfall take players on unique adventures in post-apocalyptic settings with stunning visuals.

In the past decade, survival games have really developed, moving from basic indie games to impressive, realistic-looking products. Today, the genre boasts titles that not only challenge players' endurance, but also captivate them with breathtaking visuals. No matter the setting — destroyed wasteland or foreign underwater planet — the game environments are so detailed and convincing that it’s hard to tell if they were designed based on actual place, or just an imaginative creation. Survival games are getting better with each new release, and many of them impress with their graphics. As technology improves and more attention is given to the atmosphere, the future of survival games looks promising.

This list ranks the best-looking survival games that have brought visual quality to a new level. The entries are not solely scored based on their graphics, but also the creativity of their design and how engaging the world is. Whether new to the genre or a veteran looking for a new game to try, these titles will make sure players can experience thrilling action and impressive sights.

7 Frostpunk 2

A City Builder Wrapped in Brutal Survival

Frostpunk 2
7.0 /10
Released
September 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
11 Bit Studios
Powered by

In Frostpunk 2 , players manage a Snowy Faction community, where they must use resources wisely and make difficult decisions to help their society live. Built by 11 Bit Studios, the game builds on its predecessor by bringing advanced new features and a complex plot. Players assume the part of a leader in a community struggling to survive, trying to manage both political and environmental problems.

Frostpunk 2 is truly impressive to look at. Using the Unreal Engine 5, the game gives players a bleak, yet stunning world full of small details in the cities, weather effects, and realistic light. How the city moved from being a small struggling place to a thriving metropolis is presented in fine detail, making each of the player's choices important.

6 Subnautica

Visuals That Redefine Undersea Exploration

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Powered by

The release of this game broke the trend that underwater levels are always boring. That's what many players thought before playing this game. In Subnautica , players must struggle to survive on a remote planet world underwater, where they need to search, gather, and assemble tools. Players must travel beneath the ocean as the only survivor of a spacecraft accident, find answers to the world’s secrets, keep track of their oxygen and hunger, and dodge threatening creatures.

Everything in the game is visually impressive. There are many different areas in Subnautica , from the bright coral reefs to the dark deep-sea trenches. Every biome is packed with its own plants and animals. The realism comes from the lighting and water, which only add to the exciting and thrilling atmosphere the ocean brings. Subnautica: Below Zero , the sequel, is even more gorgeous and gives the franchise even more opportunities to stand out in underwater survival.

5 Enshrouded

Mystical Realms in Ethereal Fog

Enshrouded
7.7 /10
Released
January 24, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Keen Games
Powered by

Developed by Keen Games, Enshrouded is currently only available as Early Access on PC. Set in the open world of Embervale, it's a survival action role-playing game. Players can travel where they like, build permanent strongholds, get necessary resources, and make different tools, all while figuring out how to deal with the mysterious "Shroud." Players get the choice to either manage their world by themselves in single-player mode, or play with up to 16 other people in the same multiplayer game.

Enshrouded lets gamers enjoy its fantasy setting through great graphics. The environments are carefully developed with both beautiful details and well-designed animation. The way the game handles the atmosphere gives everything a sense of mystery and more tension. As it is set for a 2025 launch, Enshrouded has every chance to become a top survival game.

4 S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl

Chornobyl Never Looked So Hauntingly Beautiful

7 Images
7 Images
S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl
28
8.5 /10
Released
November 20, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Intense Violence, Blood, Use Of Drugs And Alcohol, Language, Crude Humor
Developer(s)
GSC Game World
Powered by

S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl was developed by GSC Game World and is a first-person shooter horror game. Within the Chornobyl Exclusion Zone, players explore a wide open world filled with threats and unusual creatures, while discovering what lies beneath the Zone. Players must explore, make decisions, and stay alive, because these actions influence the game’s storyline.

Thanks to the Unreal Engine 5, S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 has some of the richest and most immersive visuals for any game in its genre. Both the abandoned cities and dark woodlands are beautifully brought to life when weather and lighting change dynamically. The game uses ray tracing and detailed textures, which help make the Zone look beautiful and make every living space unforgettable, even though calling a horror survival game beautiful feels odd.

3 No Man's Sky

From Controversial Launch to Visual Masterpiece

No Man's Sky
7 /10
48
9.1 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
7 /10
48
9.1 /10

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Developer(s)
Hello Games
Powered by

If any game took second chances seriously, then it's No Man's Sky . No Man’s Sky, which is known for procedurally building its environment. In the game, players can go to almost any planet they want, and every planet has a unique environment, weather, and resources. The design allows players to search for resources, settle down, and survive, while still encouraging their own paths of exploration.

Graphics demonstrate how effective procedural generation is in No Man’s Sky . Thanks to its rich selection of colors, different planet types, and lively weather, the world is both huge and beautiful. Every new update has enhanced the graphics, adding better lighting effects, greater details in the landscapes, and more distinctive textures on planets, which make each world more enjoyable to explore.

2 Sons of the Forest

A Horror Survival Sandbox Like No Other

Sons of the Forest
8.3 /10
Released
February 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Endnight Games
Powered by

Sons of the Forest is packed with survival horror, made by Endnight Games and following on from The Forest . Players are left on a strange island populated by cannibal mutants, forcing them to find food, find shelter, and work out the island’s mysteries to get through the dangers of the game.

The graphics are significantly improved compared to the previous installment, which already featured impressive visual design. Because of the thick forests, wild weather and accurate lighting, the game can sometimes feel very realistic and eerie. Detailed character models and animations bring the horror of the game’s monsters to life as players face them. Things such as leafy sounds and lights from burning torches help make playing especially more immersive and intense.

1 Atomfall

Retro-Futurism Meets British Apocalypse

7 Images
7 Images
Atomfall
6 /10
15
7.1 /10
Released
March 27, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
6 /10
15
7.1 /10

ESRB
Teen // Blood, Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Rebellion Developments
Powered by

Rebellion Developments developed Atomfall as an action survival game, set in an alternative version of the 1960s after the Windscale disaster turned much of northwest England into a radioactive restricted area. While traveling in the dangerous zone, players discover what happened and work their way past both abnormal creatures and rival gangs.

Atomfall looks different from other games because of its blend of older sci-fi design and destroyed post-apocalyptic scenes. Artistic reflection of 1960s Great Britain is highlighted by the scene’s eerie and damaged appearance caused by nuclear radiation. Well-designed textures, impressive lighting, and a muted color theme make the world look both menacing and impressive, helping players get involved in the game’s version of history. Visual storytelling plays a big role in helping the game stand out in the survival genre.

item.title: Adin Ross Throws Shade at 'Lazy' Streamers
item.description:
Summary

  • Adin Ross is blaming laziness from some of Kick's top creators as a major reason behind the streaming platform ending major exclusivity deals.
  • Ross claimed that many top talents coming to Kick get lazier with their streams on the platform, citing creators like BruceDropEmOff watching movies on stream and not using facecams.
  • Adin Ross has faced several questions about his status on Twitch in recent months, teasing a departure that didn't happen and seeing his Twitch account unbanned earlier this year.

Adin Ross is claiming that "lazy streamers" are to blame for Kick ending its trend of offering major deals to allure top streamers to the platform. The streaming platform built itself up as one of the biggest competitors for the juggernauts of Twitch and YouTube in its early days, promising a less restrictive environment than the Amazon and Google-owned websites. The rise of Kick even saw several big-name content creators leaving Twitch, with streamers like Amouranth and xQc making the jump to Kick. However, popular streamer Adin Ross has a theory about why Kick's big deals have slowed down.

Kick has often made itself a major topic of conversation among the streaming community, for both the good and the bad. Kick offers plenty of enticing perks for streamers looking to migrate over from other popular streaming services like Twitch, including Kick's lucrative revenue share and looser policies on content moderation. The platform has also taken plenty of heat from its detractors, citing everything from its backing from gambling website Stake to several on-stream controversies from its top talents. Now, Adin Ross is speaking out about one shift in Kick's policies.

As reported by Dexerto, Adin Ross spoke out about why he thinks Kick has ceased giving exclusivity deals to top streamers. Ross shared his belief that a major reason for Kick moving away from its exclusive deals is due to the streamers themselves, stating that several major streamers "get lazy" after signing on Kick. Adin Ross even called out popular streamer BruceDropEmOff during the Kick clip, citing Bruce moving to less taxing content like watching movies and streaming without a camera. Ross did clarify during the segment that he does not have any personal issues with Bruce.

Adin Ross Casts Blame on "Lazy" Kick Streamers

Adin Ross' stance on Kick's streamer signings comes as his own status on the platform was called into question not that long ago. Adin Ross teased a potential departure from Kick late last year, even leading to a major dispute between the platform's second-biggest talent and co-founder Ed Craven. Adin Ross also saw a major change in his status on one of Kick's biggest competitors, with the streamer finally unbanned from Twitch more than two years after his most recent suspension.

With Adin Ross staying on Kick for the foreseeable future, the streamer has already revealed some big plans in the works. Adin Ross revealed that he is planning to host his own end-of-year awards show for online content creators in 2025, planning to compete with the popular annual "Streamer Awards" later this year. Ross also teased plans for a special roleplay server for Grand Theft Auto 6 following its release, giving fans the opportunity to earn real-world money through the game. Adin Ross looks set to maintain his status as one of Kick's top streamers with several major projects in the works.

item.title: Deliver At All Costs: Tips & Tricks for Beginners
item.description:
Summary

  • Turn car 180 degrees quickly by reversing & turning, avoiding wide or time-consuming K turns.
  • Focus on current deliveries instead of green question marks to make tasks easier.
  • Start side missions early & familiarize yourself with map hazards to succeed in the game.

Deliver At All Costs is a great game to unwind and have a good laugh. The game gives players easy-to-digest moment-to-moment story progression with short scenes that use a lot of humour to really drive them home. The game will also separate deliveries with free roaming.

This can let players enjoy the game in short bursts as a means to relax, similar to playing a mobile game on their phone for 5 minutes. Players can also open up the game and just enjoy the free roaming. The majority of tips for players will come in how they play the game and how they can make the most of their time.

7 Spin 180 Degrees the Right Way

Turn The Car 180 Degrees With Little Space and In a Short Time Frame

  • Wide turns need a lot of space.
  • K-turns can be time-consuming by comparison.

Players may try to turn around by making a wide turn or performing a K-turn. A K-turn is when a car stops, reverses until it is horizontal, then goes forward while turning to face the opposite direction. Both of these may work, but they are very ineffective.

Players should rather release the forward button and press the reverse button in either direction. This will cause the car to easily spin to face the opposite direction. This can be a massive time saver and help players get back on track with ease.

6 Don’t Worry About Green Question Marks During Deliveries

Save Landmarks and Green Question Marks for Free Roaming

  • Focus on the task at hand; side missions aren’t going to disappear.
  • Make note of other landmarks for free roam.

Players will see plenty of green question marks, among other unique icons, appearing on their minimap. These special icons will still show when players open up their main map.

Players should focus on completing their current active deliveries, as focusing on these during a delivery could end up making it a lot harder than it had to be — especially when there are rowdy civilians around.

5 Don’t Leave Green Question Marks for Late Game

The Sooner Players Start a Side Mission, The Sooner They Can Complete It

  • Start side quests to complete later down the line.
  • Interact with new map icons to see what they do.

Once players transition into free roam to explore the map, they should see what new icons do and pick up many different side missions. Side quests don’t need to be instantaneous missions similar to deliveries.

Players can find themselves on the lookout for things while progressing through other parts of the game. Players should also interact with any new kind of icon they see on the map. This will trigger tutorial windows for them.

4 Get to Know the Map

Know Where Hazards Are In Advance

  • Get to know the game map.
  • Take note of hazards and where they are for later.

When players first start the game, the entire map will be a new experience. However, the more they play, the more they will remember notable aspects about it. Becoming familiar with the map will allow players to avoid potential hazards like active construction.

Not all hazards are static, and learning from situations that previously came up will make dealing with future occurrences easier.

3 Explore Between Deliveries

There Are Many Hidden Treasures to Find During Free Roaming

  • Break open crates for extra cash.
  • Seek out hidden chests in secret areas.

Players will see interesting things that may not have an icon on their minimap. Players can interact with wrapped-up crates for some extra cash or drive straight through these crates when they are on the side of the road.

Always pull over and explore interesting areas such as caves and ladders. These paths can even lead to finding secret areas. These secret areas are the perfect places for players to stumble upon hidden chests.

Players will see a saving prompt from time to time. However, they can also manually initiate a save from the options menu before they leave the game while free roaming.

2 Use The Nearest Phone Booth

When the Car Is Too Far, Make a Call

  • Use a phonebooth when the delivery vehicle is far away.
  • Use a phonebooth when the delivery vehicle is inaccessible.

Players may see one of the many phone booths around the city as they drive around. However, these are not purely for the aesthetic of the time period. They serve a mechanical use.

Players can use one of these booths to show them the location of their delivery vehicle and even pull it back from the brink after a cataclysmic mishap. This can make them an invaluable asset in both free roam and while out on deliveries.

1 Deal With Angry Citizens

Know When to Shove and When to Run

  • When it’s just one angry civilian, choose to fight.
  • When there is more than one, choose flight.

Angry citizens will come at players throughout the game. This can be because they initiated a confrontation with them or because the nature of the player’s current delivery actively annoys them.

When they have just one to deal with, giving them a shove can give players a leg up to get back into their car and drive away. However, sometimes there may be many angry civilians plying on the player. In this case, players can apply zombieland logic and sprint in a wide circle to get back into their delivery vehicle and get out of there.

12 Images
12 Images
Deliver At All Costs
Action
Adventure
Sandbox
Open-World
Exploration
Systems
Released
May 22, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
8 /10

Developer(s)
